payload.title: Incident Response
payload.alignment: Security incident procedures aligned with RFC-0020 fail-closed semantics.

severity_model.description: Active exploitation or immediate safety/integrity risk.
Major security impact without confirmed active exploitation.
Minor security debt or process gap.

universal_rules: Prefer fail-closed degradation over uncertain continuation.
Preserve evidence as digests plus logs plus receipt pointers without mutating originals.
Record timeline, scope, decisions, and recovery actions.
Open follow-up remediation work with explicit verification criteria.

playbooks.title: Secret Leak
triggers: Credential exposure in repository, logs, artifacts, or external channels.
immediate_actions: Revoke leaked credentials.
Rotate adjacent credentials that may also be exposed.
Audit access and usage logs for abuse.
Preserve evidence and incident timeline.
containment_checks: Disable affected automation paths if credential scope is unclear.
Confirm no secrets appear in release artifacts, logs, or error channels.

playbooks.title: Identity/Freshness Incident (HSI-Critical)
triggers: Stale or unverifiable directory heads accepted.
immediate_actions: Deny Tier2+ actuation paths dependent on affected trust state.
Force refresh and revalidation of identity trust anchors.
Invalidate verifier caches tied to suspect head or proof artifacts.
Preserve proof artifacts and verification logs.
playbooks.containment_goal: No actuation under stale or unverifiable identity authority.

playbooks.title: Receipt Authentication Failure
triggers: Mismatched inclusion proofs or invalid batch-root anchoring.
immediate_actions: Treat affected facts as non-authoritative.
Halt promotion and actuation paths consuming those facts.
Fall back to stricter verification paths where available.
Emit defects and isolate impacted producers.

playbooks.title: Delegation Widening / Confused Deputy
triggers: Downstream capability wider than parent authority.
immediate_actions: Revoke affected delegation chain.
Deny dependent episodes.
Preserve delegation artifacts and policy evaluation traces.
Patch and test strict-subset and meet enforcement.

playbooks.title: Dependency / Supply-Chain Vulnerability
triggers: Known vulnerability in direct or transitive dependency.
immediate_actions: Assess exploitability in APM2 context.
Block release for affected versions until mitigated.
Upgrade or replace dependency and add regression test.
Publish advisory where required.

playbooks.title: Malicious Dependency
triggers: Evidence of dependency compromise or malicious behavior.
immediate_actions: Remove dependency immediately.
Rebuild from clean state.
Audit build-script, network, and file-system behavior.
Report upstream through RustSec and ecosystem channels as appropriate.

evidence_preservation_checklist: Record incident start time and detection source.
Record hashes of key artifacts and log bundles.
Capture relevant receipt IDs and hashes.
Capture affected identity, capability, and policy version data.

notes: Advisory format corresponds to GitHub Security Advisory publication flow.

closure_criteria: Regression controls (tests, policy, tooling) are in place.

contacts.responsibility: Receive external reports and coordinate disclosure.

payload.reporting_channel: GitHub Security Advisories private disclosure workflow.

evidence_strategy: Store and exchange digest-addressed evidence pointers instead of raw payload replication by default.
Use receipt pointers and Merkle-batch references for high-volume incident traces.
Preserve canonical hashes first, then selectively hydrate detailed artifacts for investigation.
verification_cost_controls: Use logarithmic membership proofs for receipt inclusion where available.
Bound decode and proof-size acceptance during incident ingestion.
Prefer cached trust roots and batch verification for large-scale evidence sets.

cryptography_posture.pqc_note: PQC migration work is deferred; current response procedures align to active RFC-0020 trust and freshness primitives.
